reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent four nights at Hotel Centrale in Bellagio. We chose this Hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. A lovely family owned boutique hotel where you are made to feel very welcome. The rooms are not large but very well appointed comfortable and clean. A very good breakfast, the coffee is excellent. Check out the paintings of flowers in the hotel, they are done by the owners mother...just beautiful. The recommendtions for restaurants did not disapoint and we enjoyed some excellent food.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Hotel after reading the positive reviews on tripadvisor, and our expectations were exceeded in every way. The owners of the hotel were very friendly and accommodating in every way. The hotel is in a great location, very peaceful and with many restaurants nearby. The room we were given, even though a little bit small, was fine and well maintained.
reviews.title: Great hotel, beautiful location!!!

likes.disliked: — Small room but did not matter that much!

reviews.text: All in all, this hotel is good value for the money compared to other hotels and I would not hesitate to recommend it.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet, great location, great value

likes.liked: — It was quiet but very central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a small hotel located one block off the lake. The hotel was completely renovated in 2004. The rooms are nicely appointed and clean. We loved the quiet location on a tiny side street. It is family-run and very, very nice. I strongly recommend this hotel. I would stay there again anytime. I usually stay in the name-brand hotels and pay much more. I was very nervous about my decision to book at this hotel because of the price (low), but it turned out to be wonderful.
reviews.title: Excellent Hospitality!

reviews.text: My husband and I were on our honeymoon and our last stop was Bellagio. We stayed there only for two days, but they were two days we will never forget. The owners of the hotel, the Borelli family, only added to our wonderful vacation. The hotel is in a great location and even though we did not have a view of the lake from our balcony, there was an outdoor terrace that did have a view. On our last day there, we found a bottle of champagne and strawberries in our room congratulating us. And because we had to check out early the next day, they had breakfast delivered the night before to our room. I have nevered had such great hospitality from any other hotel - EVER!
reviews.title: Excellent Value in Bellagio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 2 days and had a wonderful time even though the weather was terrible.
reviews.title: First Class Hotel

reviews.text: This is THE place to stay in Bellagio. Lovely rooms, in the centre of the town.
reviews.title: great value hotel in a good location.
I can't get Hotel Centrale off my mind!
reviews.text: If arriving by car contact the hotel for directions to park, 1 hour max, in the church square at the top end of the the street. That way you can take your luggage down rather than up. Once at the hotel they will give you directions to park on-street for free.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic owners, excellent English.
reviews.title: Nice Place and Good Value

reviews.text: Clean quiet rooms, good bathrooms, excellent air-conditioning, firendly staff and a nice breakfast. The location is ideal (about 200m from the main ferry pier) - it's not on the lakeside but that's undoubtedly what keeps the price sensible.
reviews.title: good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Could not have wished for more, great location, fantastic spotless room, even an electric skylight. Giacomo and his family are very friendly and helpful. Make sure you listen to their restarant tips, they were never wrong in our 6 day stay.
reviews.title: What a find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Hotel Centrale after reading the positive reviews on this website, and our expectations were exceeded in every way. Our room was on the third floor, a little small by American standards but completely charming, with a compact, spotless bathroom, comfortable bed, antique furnishings, and two windows--one of which gave us a glimpse of the cobalt blue waters of Lake Como. Yes, it's quite a hike up the ancient stone stairs from the waterfront, but lugging suitcases up the backbreaking climb is worth it when the hotel's picturesque courtyard suddenly appears on the left. The breakfast room is lovely, and breakfast features a ton of food, including meats, cheeses, cereals, croissants, fresh fruit, and endless cappucino. The staff is is pleasant and extremely helpful. Unless you are deadset on having direct views of the lake, you will not regret staying at the Hotel Centrale. It is the perfect spot for getting to know the Lake Como area.
reviews.title: A Relaxing Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone's review is spot on. The owner, Giacomo, is friendly and helpful. Bellagio is the perfect vacation spot and Hotel Centrale exceeded my expectations. Great value, too. Be sure to chat with Giacomo and get his dining recommendations. I recommend Bellagio and Hotel Centrale to everyone.
reviews.title: Thank you, Giacomo!

likes.liked: — Family run business. Owner, Giacomo, made us feel welcome and was quite engaging.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Jason & Helen
reviews.title: One of the best places we've ever stayed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

likes.disliked: — The steps in Bellagio are adorable but a workout.

reviews.title: A magical experience in Bellagio
reviews.text: After reading all of the reviews for Lake Como, we decided to stay at the Hotel Centrale in Bellagio for 4 nights in July, 2007. We were very happy that we made this decision. First, it is right in the middle of Bellagio so it's very easy to ge to any of the restaurants or activities. Unfortunately, we did not get one of the upper rooms but our room was very satisfactory for our needs. The main reason this hotel is so successful is because of the family that owns it. Giacomo, his wife and two teenage sons really make you feel as if you're staying in their home. When we arrived we told them that it would be difficult for us to bring our luggage up the 63 steps so Giacomo came down and brought up our luggage. This was the beginning of the way he treated us throughout our stay. Bellagio is a magical place and staying at the Hotel Centrale gave us a true Italian experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I share the enthusiastic responses of fellow trip advisor members. Just back from Hotel Centrale and Giacomo and his family were as friendly and helpful as described in other reviews.
reviews.title: Loved Hotel Centrale

reviews.text: When you stay here, you feel like you are actually being hosted by the family.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Experience

likes.disliked: — There was nothing I didn't like.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a little wistful for the locations directly on the lake, but our room was spotless and lovely and the warmth of the family made up for the fact that we weren't right on the lake.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just returned from my trip and I want to tell other travelers about this wonderful hotel. You walk through the archway and you feel like you are in your own home. There is a small front garden with a wonderul old tree and places to sit. Your host is Giacomo and his family who are very helpful. I had a room on the first floor and so did my friends. Our doors opened to our own private terrace , where we would sit at night .From the terrace we had a view of the lake. The room was spotless. For breakfast, you go into a lovely enclosed sunroom. this hotel is a gem and the surrounding area is lovely. Don't be fooled by the 3 stars. It is worth much more.
reviews.title: Mixed Review...
